mapper.sql: id, disabled, resource_code, name, parent_id, resource_type, url, create_time, create_uid, update_time, update_uid, icon, path, component, redirect
mapper.select: SELECT sp.id, sp.disabled, sp.resource_code, sp.name, sp.parent_id, sp.resource_type, sp.url, sp.create_time, sp.create_uid, sp.update_time, sp.update_uid, (select count(*) from t_sys_permission p where p.parent_id = sp.id) childCount, icon, path, component, redirect FROM t_sys_permission sp WHERE sp.id IN (SELECT rp.permission_id FROM t_sys_role_permission rp WHERE rp.role_id = #{roleId}) and sp.disabled = 0 order by update_time desc

SELECT sp.id, sp.resource_code, sp.name, sp.parent_id, sp.resource_type, sp.url FROM t_sys_permission sp INNER JOIN t_sys_role_permission rp ON sp.id = rp.permission_id INNER JOIN t_sys_user_role ur ON ur.role_id = rp.role_id INNER JOIN t_sys_role sr ON sr.id = rp.role_id WHERE sp.disabled = 0 AND sr.disabled = 0 AND ur.user_id = #{userId} ORDER BY sp.id

SELECT sp.resource_code FROM t_sys_permission sp INNER JOIN t_sys_role_permission rp ON sp.id = rp.permission_id INNER JOIN t_sys_user_role ur ON ur.role_id = rp.role_id INNER JOIN t_sys_role sr ON sr.id = rp.role_id WHERE sp.disabled = 0 AND sr.disabled = 0 AND ur.user_id = #{userId}
select id, parent_id as parentId, name as label from t_sys_permission where disabled = 0 and id != 21
